oai_dc:dc.dc:title: ON THE TESTING OF MODELS IN MULTIDIRECTIONAL SEAS
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Funke, E.R.
Mansard, E.P.D.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: multidirectional sea
model testing
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Although traditional model testing of marine structures in long-crested, unidirectional (2D) waves can lead to conservative results in certain applications, modern multidirectional (3D) wave generators can produce more realistic sea conditions, leading to the design of more accurate, cost-effective and safer structures. This paper justifies the requirements for testing in 3D seas.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Coastal Engineering Proceedings; No. 23 (1992): Proceedings of 23rd Conference on Coastal Engineering, Venice, Italy, 1992.
